data: Routine, Reason: Pre Contraction Stress Test, for a minimum of 20 minutes
Do not select 500 mL sodium chloride bolus if contraindicated by maternal condition (e.g. hypertensive disorders or cardiovascular conditions)
500 mL, IV, once, PRN other (see comment), administer over: 10 minute, drug form: bag
250 mL, IV, once, PRN other (see comment), administer over: 10 minute, drug form: bag
oxytocin titratable infusion (0.06 units/mL) in NS standard

titrate, IV, 2 milliunit/min starting rate, 2 milliunit/min minimum rate, 20 milliunit/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: Titrate by 1 to 2 milliunits/min at 30 minute intervals until 3 contractions lasting 1 minute each within a 10 min period occur
oxytocin titratable infusion (0.06 units/mL) in NS standard

titrate, IV, 2 milliunit/min starting rate, 2 milliunit/min minimum rate, 20 milliunit/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: Titrate by 2 to 4 milliunits/min at 30 minute intervals until 3 contractions lasting 1 minute each within a 10 min period occur
When Contraction Stress Test is complete. Test is complete when uterine contraction pattern (3 contractions lasting 1 minute each within a 10 minute period) is achieved
Instructions for nipple stimulation as per order comment:
